hero.title: Guide to Practices for the Development and Promotion of Entrepreneurship
hero.description: In Special Schools: A Comprehensive Guide for Educators, Parents, and Stakeholders.

preface.title: Preface
paragraphs: The guide you are reading was created as part of the implementation of the approved European programme Erasmus+ entitled “Our tradition… our entrepreneurship!”.

Our basic idea was to combine local tradition with students’ skills. Through ceramics and art workshops, students worked on new techniques, exchanged ideas, and created products inspired by the culture of each region.

law.title: Legislation & Rights
law.description: The UN has adopted the Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities. Regarding work, Article 27 recognizes that persons with disabilities have the same right to employment as any other citizen.
rights: Elimination of discrimination at every stage of employment.
Protection for fair wages and equal opportunities.
Access to career guidance and training.
Adaptation of workplaces to the needs of persons with disabilities.
law.lawCardDesc: According to the Constitution (Article 21, par. 6), people with disabilities have the right to professional integration.
law.lawDesc: Businesses with over 50 people are required to hire 8% of people with disabilities.

employment.title: Type of Employment
employment.puDesc: Recruitment through ASEP with special points or announcements exclusively for people with disabilities (e.g. 6K/2024).
employment.prDesc: Businesses, KINSEP and NGOs. 8% recruitment obligation for large companies.
employment.frDesc: Possibility of self-employment with significant tax breaks.

business.title: Entrepreneurship in Special Schools
business.description: Entrepreneurship is not just an activity, but a mechanism for strengthening students’ active participation in society.
